topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554e8af66368723ee7ef0400#post_554e8af66368723ee7ef0400
Call me crazy, but I have a feeling eventually the whole internet reviewer thing is going to have a crash like how ten years ago there was webcomics all over the place and people were making money off it then once there was too many it went *pop*.

What I mean by this can even be seen with channel awesome; besides doug there's only one other person on the channel that actually brings any money in cause everyone else is a money pit.  If he were to kick everyone else out and just be the nostalgia critic he would actually be making more money off it.  The nostalgia chick, linkara, etc actually cost his company more money than they actually bring in.

When it comes to internet reviewers for media every few years people get excited for the new fad thinking they'll be the next big thing, but it turns out that only a couple of people are financially successful and as a result the fad dies out.

A long term example of this is looking at the 15 year financial trend for machinima; back in 2006 people were making tons of money off machinima, now the only people making money off machinima are roosterteeth, ross scott, daschboshitt and a handful of people.


Tl:dr;
Internet, "Oh wow!  A new thing that I can become the new internet popular person with and make a living off of!"
*too many people trying to get into the new thing*
Internet, "OH SHIT!  It turned out that I overestimated the financial revenue generated from this new thing and only a handful of people are actually making a living off it!"


Examples; machinima, webcomics, only a handful of internet reviewers make enough money to quit their day job; this is eventually going to happen to letsplayers where only the most popular ones like twobestfriends, markiplier and other people that popular continue to make a living off it whereas everyone else has to find a day job.


Unfortunately doug walker will probably be always around, but in say five/ten years it will just be the nostalgia critic and the rest of channel awesome will no longer exist.
